title: Bun v0.8.0 | Bun Blog

title: #Shitoberfest: How free T-shirts ruined #Hacktoberfest2020 – Hwee's Portfolio – Data Engineer. Loves things that fly.
description: Hacktoberfest is an annual event organized by DigitalOcean that celebrates open-source contributions. Occuring every October, the goal of Hacktoberfest is to encourage developers (of all backgrounds and skill level) and companies to make positive contributions to the open-source community. All these sound like an initiative with good intentions on paper - incentivise developers to contribute to open-source projects. Unfortunately, the organizers underestimated the extent of what people are willing to do for the sake of getting free T-shirts (or freebies in general).

title: Abhimanyu Mishra Becomes Youngest Grandmaster In Chess History - Chess.com
description: IM Abhimanyu Mishra became the youngest chess grandmaster in history today. The 12-year-old player from New Jersey scored his third GM norm in Budapest, having already crossed the required 2500 Elo rating barrier. Mishra (often called "Abhi") broke GM Sergey Karjakin's record that has stood for 19 years.

title: AI Isn’t Good Enough - by SK Ventures

No one paid you $1,000 signing bonuses to work for fast-food restaurants.

title: Block YouTube Ads on AppleTV by Decrypting and Stripping Ads from Profobuf
description: Apple TV and iOS YouTube ads are not blocked by Pi-hole, so I researched this and discovered a flaw in Protobuf that allows me to restrict YouTube ads.

title: Windows 11 will create heaps of needless trash
description: The latest announcements for Windows 11 have revealed that the next version of the Windows operating system will have very stringent hardware requirements. Some of them are, in my opinion, quite reasonable. For example, they’re finally dropping support for 32 bit X86 and legacy BIOS boot. These make sense, because almost every PC manufactured since 2011 has supported X64 and UEFI. It also sheds a substantial amount of technical debt and cruft, and simplifies the system slightly.
